info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 3:56PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL AND SOUTHEASTERN MORA COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM MDT... At 356 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles south of Watrous, or 17 miles east of Las Vegas, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Valmora and Shoemaker. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 near Mile Marker 373. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 10 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for northeastern New Mexico.
